terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.accept: I accept the Terms and Conditions
terms.content:
ARTICLE 1: Purpose

These Terms and Conditions (T&Cs) legally govern the use of the Secuderm mobile application, a medical monitoring application using photographs. Any access to and use of this application implies acceptance of and compliance with all the terms of these conditions.

ARTICLE 2: Legal notice

The Secuderm application is developed by Secuderm company, whose complete details appear in the legal notices of the application. The application is available on iOS and Android platforms.

ARTICLE 3: Access to services

The application provides the user with access to the following services:
- Medical monitoring of wounds or dressings through photographs
- QR code scanning for dressing identification
- Adding comments to different photographs
- Management of medical data related to care monitoring

Access to the application requires an internet connection and a user account. The costs incurred by the user to access it (internet connection, equipment) are not the responsibility of Secuderm.

ARTICLE 4: Medical data and confidentiality

The data collected via the Secuderm application is considered personal health data and is therefore protected by medical confidentiality and processed in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and applicable national laws on personal data protection.

The user expressly consents to the collection, processing, and storage of medical data concerning them or concerning patients whose monitoring they ensure. This data includes in particular:
- Photographs of wounds and dressings
- Comments associated with photographs
- Dressing identifiers via QR code
- Dates and times of photographs

This data is kept for a limited period defined in our privacy policy, accessible from the application.

ARTICLE 5: User rights

In accordance with applicable regulations, the user has the right to access, rectify, delete, limit processing, portability, and object to data concerning them.

To exercise these rights, the user can contact Secuderm at the email address indicated in the legal notices of the application.

ARTICLE 6: Responsibilities

The Secuderm application is a tool to aid medical monitoring and does not in any way substitute for a medical consultation or professional health advice.

Secuderm company cannot be held responsible for:
- The consequences of inappropriate use of the application
- Medical decisions made based on information present in the application
- Technical malfunctions beyond its control (connection problems, compatibility with certain devices)
- The quality of photographs taken by the user

The user is solely responsible for the relevance and accuracy of the information they enter into the application.

ARTICLE 7: Intellectual property

All elements constituting the Secuderm application (texts, graphics, software, photographs, images, videos, sounds, logos, etc.) as well as the application itself are the exclusive property of Secuderm or are subject to authorization for use. Any reproduction, representation, modification, publication, total or partial adaptation of these elements, regardless of the means or process used, is prohibited without the prior written authorization of Secuderm.

ARTICLE 8: Security

The user agrees not to compromise the security of the application. In particular, they must not:
- Access data that is not intended for them
- Decompile, disassemble, or attempt to access the application's source code
- Test the vulnerability of the application's systems
- Attempt to disrupt or hinder the functioning of the application's servers

In the event of violation of these commitments, access to the application may be immediately suspended.

ARTICLE 9: Modifications to the T&Cs

Secuderm company reserves the right to modify these T&Cs at any time. The user will be informed of the modifications by any appropriate means. Continued use of the application after notification of modifications constitutes acceptance of these modifications.

ARTICLE 10: Applicable law and jurisdiction

These T&Cs are governed by French legislation. In the event of a dispute, the parties undertake to seek an amicable solution. Failing agreement, French courts will have sole jurisdiction to settle the dispute.
